metadata.title: CVE-2016-9914 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Memory leak in hw/9pfs/9p.c in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) allows localprivileged guest OS users to cause a denial of service (host memoryconsumption and possibly QEMU process crash) by leveraging a missingcleanup operation in FileOperations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9914` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-kvm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-common - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-data - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-gui - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-user - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-user-static - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
qemu-utils - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2.1').
